DOCNAME: CASE OF ATANASOVIC AND OTHERS v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , are nationals of the former GPE , who were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively , and live in GPE , the former GPE .

CARDINAL . By judgments of the then ORG ( PERSON суд во ORG ) of DATE and CARDINAL DATE , the applicants obtained parts of the movable and immovable property of ORG , the father of the first and the second applicants .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicants instituted proceedings to divide the property of Mr S.A. On DATE ORG decided the ORG claim and divided the property at issue . Mr S.A. was also ordered to pay certain amounts to each of the applicants , in compensation for the movable property that was awarded only to him .
CARDINAL . As Mr S.A. did not comply , the applicants instituted enforcement proceedings before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered public sale of certain items belonging to ORG to satisfy the ORG claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG accepted Mr ORG objection that the interest had been miscalculated and ordered a new calculation .
CARDINAL . On DATE Mr S.A. passed away . On DATE the court stayed the enforcement proceedings pending the decision as to the succession to Mr S.A. ’s estate .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , delivered in separate succession proceedings , ORG determined CARDINAL heirs of ORG estate : the first and second applicants and their CARDINAL brothers – Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr GPE Each of the heirs obtained equal parts of their late father ’s estate .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the applicants asked ORG to continue the enforcement proceedings against CARDINAL of their brothers , PERSON The applicants argued that Mr PERSON should take over his late father ’s debts towards them as he had allegedly been in possession of Mr. PERSON s estate before his death and had benefited from it .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court granted the ORG request and approved the enforcement of their claims against Mr GPE

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld PERSON challenge and stayed the enforcement proceedings . The court decided to continue the proceedings against all CARDINAL heirs for the execution of the third applicant ’s claims only . The first and the second applicants were thus named debtors and the third applicant - the sole creditor .

CARDINAL . On DATE the then ORG ( NORP суд во GPE ) upheld the applicants’ and PERSON complaints . It quashed the lower court ’s decision and ordered a retrial . It , inter alia , instructed the lower court to examine the case on the basis of CARDINAL of the PERSON on inheritance whether and , if so , to what extent , PERSON ORG owed sums of money to the applicants . It also instructed the lower court to establish whether the amount of the debt was correctly calculated .
CARDINAL . No further actions were taken by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested ORG to resume the enforcement proceedings and to re - evaluate their original claims . They received no reply to their request .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL , in so far as relevant , provides that a judge shall be discharged : with regard to a serious disciplinary offence as defined by law , making him / her unsuitable to perform the office of a judge as decided by ORG ; with regard to the unprofessional and unethical conduct of a judge , as described by ORG in a procedure set forth by law .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that ORG proposes to the [ ORG the election and discharge of judges and determines proposals for the discharge of a judge in cases set forth in the LAW ; decides on the disciplinary responsibility of judges ; assesses the competence and ethical behaviour of judges in the performance of their office .
CARDINAL . According to LAW , ORG carries out tasks related to the judiciary ’s administration .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that ORG communicates with ORG with regard to the court ’s administration .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that the following matters fall within the court ’s administration : the examination of the petitions and complaints of citizens concerning the work of the courts in respect to postponement of the proceedings or the work of the court services ; the supervision of the court ’s efficiency .
CARDINAL . According to LAW the President of the ORG represents the latter , organises its work and takes measures with regard to the prompt and regular enforcement of the court ’s affairs .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that the ORG assesses the ability and moral character of the judges when the information concerning the results achieved , the number of the cases resolved , the quality and promptness of their work indicate that the office of a judge has been performed unprofessionally , unethically and incompetently in general .
